Literature Review: Emotions are fundamental to our experience and behavior, affecting and motivating all aspects of our lives. The neural circuits underlying emotion processing have been a subject of intense research across various disciplines, including behavioral, systems, and circuit neurosciences. This review aims to provide an overview of the current understanding of emotion processing in diverse species, highlighting points of convergence and identifying important next steps in the pursuit of understanding how emotions emerge from neural activity.
